notes: Johansson did not return to Wednesday's (Jan. 15) game against the Oilers.
Tavares left practice on Wednesday (Jan. 15) and is day-to-day according to Jonas Siegel of The Athletic.
The Kings announced that Laferriere has been ruled out for Thursday's (Jan. 16) game against the Canucks, per Zach Dooley of the Kings' official site.
The Canadiens announced Heineman was involved in a traffic accident yesterday as a pedestrian. Heineman sustained an upper-body injury and will be out 3-4 weeks.
Motte won't travel with the Red Wings for the start of their upcoming four-game road trip, which begins Thursday (Jan. 15) versus the Panthers, as per Carley Johnston of the Red Wings' official site.
Noesen did not play in Tuesday's (Jan. 14) game versus the Panthers.
Hintz did not return to Tuesday's (Jan. 14) game versus the Maple Leafs.
Pageau did not play in Tuesday's (Jan. 14) game versus the Senators.
The Panthers Ekblad (undisclosed) won't travel with the Panthers for the team's two-game road trip, Jordan McPherson of the Miami Herald reports Sunday.
Romanov did not play in Tuesday's (Jan. 14) matchup versus Ottawa.
Reihardt did not play in Tuesday's (Jan. 14) game against the Islanders.
Namestnikov did not play in Tuesday's (Jan. 14) game against the Vancouver.
The Boston Bruins placed D Charlie McAvoy on Injured Reserve Tuesday (Jan. 14).
The Utah Hockey Club placed F Dylan Guenther on injured reserve on Tuesday (Jan. 14).
The San Jose Sharks placed F Klim Kostin on injured reserve.
The Washington Capitals placed G Charlie Lindgren on Injured Reserve on Saturday (Jan. 11).
Brodin won't play in Wednesday's (Jan. 15) home game against the Oilers, as per Jessi Pierce of NHL.com reports.
Smith did not play in Monday's (Jan. 13) game against Calgary.
Girard did not play in Tuesday's (Jan. 14) game against the Rangers.
The Boston Bruins placed F Mark Kastelic on Injured Reserve Tuesday (Jan. 14).
The San Jose Sharks placed F Nikolai Kovalenko on injured reserve.
Gregor will be out for a while after suffering the injury in Thursday's (Jan. 9) game against the Sabres, as per Bruce Garrioch of Postmedia.
The Buffalo Sabres placed F Jiri Kulich on injured reserve on Wednesday (Jan. 8).
As per Andrew Gross of Newsday, Fasching will miss the next two weeks, according to general manager Lou Lamoriello on Thursday (Jan. 9).
The Columbus Blue Jackets announced on Friday (Jan. 10) that Monahan has a sprained wrist and is expected to miss at least the next 7-10 days.
Lyon will travel with the Red Wings for their four-game road trip, as per Daniella Bruce of the Red Wings' official site.
The Calgary Flames placed F Connor Zary on injured reserve on Friday (Jan. 10).
The Ottawa Senators placed D Jacob Bernard-Docker on Injured Reserve on Friday (Jan. 10).
Evangelista will miss the next 4 weeks, as per Robby Stanley of NHL.com reports Thursday (Jan. 9).
Faber will not be in the lineup against the Oilers on Wednesday's (Jan. 15), as per Jessi Pierce of NHL.com reports.
Head coach Sheldon Keefe said Monday that Haula could miss a few weeks due to a sprained ankle, according to Amanda Stein of the Devils' official site.
Carrier did not play in Wednesday's (Jan. 15) game versus the Sabres.
The Ottawa Senators placed D Travis Hamonic on Injured Reserve Monday (Jan. 6).
The Toronto Maple Leafs placed D Jake McCabe on Injured Reserve Monday (Jan. 6).
The Detroit Red Wings placed D Jeff Petry on injured reserve on Wednesday (Jan. 8).
The Utah Hockey Club placed D Robert Bortuzzo on the Injured Reserve.
Miller will miss at least two weeks after suffering a fracture in his larynx, according to Mitchell Clinton of the Jets' official site.
The Seattle Kraken placed F Yanni Gourde on Injured Reserve Sunday (Jan. 5).
The Vancouver Canucks placed F Dakota Joshua on the Injured Reserve Monday (Jan. 6).
Coach Rod Brind'Amour announced on Saturday (Jan. 4) that Jost is out indefinitely, per Walt Ruff of the Hurricanes' official site.
Murphy will remain unavailable for a bit, coach Anders Sorensen told Scott Powers of The Athletic on Saturday. He was also placed on injured reserve, per the NHL media site.
The Minnesota Wild announced on Saturday (Jan. 11) that Kaprizov doesn't have a timeline for his return to the lineup, per Joe Smith of The Athletic.
Wilsby is considered week-to-week and is still on Injury Reserve, According to Robby Stanley of NHL.com Thursday (Jan. 9).
The Minnesota Wild placed D Jared Spurgeon on injured reserve on Monday (Jan. 6).
The Nashville Predators placed D Jeremy Lauzon on Injured Reserve Monday (Jan. 6).
The Avalanche announced Nichushkin is not expected back any time soon with head coach Jared Bednar telling reporters Monday the winger
The Winnipeg Jets placed F Mason Appleton on injured reserve on Friday (Jan. 3).
The New York Islanders placed F Simon Holmstrom on Injured Reserve on Tuesday (Jan. 7).
The Anaheim Ducks placed F Brock McGinn on injured reserve on Sunday (Dec. 29).
Marchment had surgery to address fractures in his nose and face and is likely out until late January, according to Owen Newkirk of DLLS Sports.
The Winnipeg Jets placed D Haydn Fleury on injured reserve on Monday (Dec. 30).
The Nashville Predators placed F Cole Smith on injured reserve and will miss 4-6 weeks.
Gadjovich won't travel with the Panthers on their upcoming two-game road trip, Jordan McPherson of the Miami Herald reports.
The Ottawa Senators placed G Linus Ullmark on Injured Reserve Tuesday (Jan. 7).
The Senators announced on Friday (Dec. 27) that Amadio will be unavailable for a while, head coach Travis Green told TSN 1200 Ottawa.
The Buffalo Sabres placed F Jordan Greenway on injured reserve on Friday (Dec. 20).
The Sharks announced on Saturday (Dec. 28) that Vanecek is week-to-week with a fractured cheekbone, per Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now.
The Minnesota Wild placed F Jakub Lauko on long-term injured reserve on Wednesday (Jan. 8).
Regula was never taken off the season-opening injured reserve despite being waived by Boston and claimed by Edmonton on Wednesday (Dec. 11), per Daniel Nugent-Bowman of The Athletic.
The Lightning said on Thursday (Dec. 19) that Moser is expected to miss 8-10 weeks with a lower body injury.
The Maple Leafs said on Tuesday (Dec. 17) that Stolarz is expected to miss the next 4-6 weeks after undergoing a procedure to remove a loose body in his knee.
The Columbus Blue Jackets placed F Justin Danforth on injured reserve on Sunday (Dec. 22).
The Philadelphia Flyers placed F Nicolas Deslauriers on injured reserve on Friday (Dec. 6).
The New York Islanders placed G Semyon Varlamov on long-term injured reserve on Thursday (Dec. 19).
The Ducks said Zegras had successful knee surgery on Thursday (Dec. 12) to repair a torn meniscus and is expected to miss six weeks.

Seguin will be out of action for 4-6 months when he undergoes surgery on Thursday (Dec. 5) for a left-side femoral acetabular impingement and hip labrum, per Lia Assimakopoulos of The Dallas Morning News.
Chinakhov completed a solo skating session on Wednesday (Dec. 18) but is without a timeline to return, per Aaron Portzline of The Athletic.
The Flames announced that Kirkland underwent successful ACL surgery on Wednesday (Dec. 4) and he will be out for the remainder of the season.
The Colorado Avalanche placed D Oliver Kylington on injured reserve on Wednesday (Jan. 1).
The Colorado Avalanche announced on Saturday (Dec. 28) that Wood is not close to a return but remains on his timeline, per Ryan Boulding of NHL.com.
The Ottawa Senators placed F Davis Perron on injured reserve on Saturday (Dec. 28).
The Maple Leafs placed D Jani Hakanpaa on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Dec. 31).
The Seattle Kraken placed F Jordan Eberle on long-term injured reserve on Saturday (Nov. 30).
The Boston Bruins placed D Hampus Lindholm on Long Term Injured Reserve Tuesday (Jan. 14).
The Washington Capitals placed F Sonny Milano on long-term injured reserve on Wednesday (Nov. 20), per Stephen Whyno of the Associated Press.
The Flames announced that Mantha will require surgery on his ACL on Thursday (Nov. 14) and will miss the remainder of the 2024-25 season.
Reilly (heart procedure) has been placed on LTIR on Tuesday (Jan. 7). He will be out indefinitely.
The Carolina Hurricanes placed G Frederik Andersen on injured reserve on Tuesday (Jan. 14).
Leddy doesn't have a timetable for his return to the lineup, and still remains on injured reserve as of Tuesday (Jan. 7), per Matthew DeFranks of the St. Louis Post-Dispatch.
The Blue Jackets announced on Tuesday (Oct. 22) that Gudbranson underwent successful shoulder surgery on Monday (Oct. 21) and is without a timetable to return.
The Utah Hockey Club announced on Wednesday (Oct. 23) that Durzi has undergone successful shoulder surgery and is expected to return in 4-6 months.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed D Lukas Cormier on injured reserve non-roster list on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Colorado Avalanche placed D Tucker Poolman on long-term injured reserve. He didn't play in 2023-24 due to migraines and won't be available for the 2024-25 campaign either.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Jordan Gustafson on injured reserve non-roster list on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Philadelphia Flyers placed D Ryan Ellis on injured reserve on Monday (Oct. 7).
Jenner has resumed skating on Tuesday (Dec. 10) and would miss 5-6 months, per Mark Scheig of The Hockey Writers.
The Maple Leafs said Jarnkrok had surgery on Monday (Nov. 18) to repair a sports hernia and is now considered month-to-month.

Grosenick underwent successful surgery on Wednesday (Oct. 2) to repair a torn ACL in his right knee and will not play this season. He is expected to make a full recovery and be ready for the start of the 2025-26 season.
The Canadiens said that Reinbacher underwent surgery to his left knee on Tuesday (Oct. 1) and is out for 5-to-6 months.
The Nashville Predators placed F Austin Roest on injured reserve non-roster list on Sunday (Sept. 29).
The Devils said that Hatakka underwent successful shoulder surgery on Thursday (Oct. 10) and is without a timetable to return.

Doughty took a significant step in his recovery process by resuming skating on Tuesday (Dec. 31) and it's possible that he will be in the mix to return to game action sometime in January, per Zach Dooley of the Kings' official site.
Couture has not resumed skating on Friday (Nov. 1) and remains without a timeline to return, per Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now.
The Oilers announced that Kane underwent successful knee surgery on Thursday (Jan. 9) and is expected to be sidelined for another 4-8 weeks.

The Capitals said on Wednesday (Sept. 18) that Oshie will be put on long-term injured reserve due to a chronic back injury which is expected to cost him the entire 2024-25 campaign, per Tom Gulitti of NHL.com.
The St. Louis Blues placed D Torey Krug on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Carolina Hurricanes placed F Jesper Fast on long-term injured reserve on Wednesday (Oct. 9).
Brossoit had another procedure done on Friday (Nov. 29) and is expected to be out for another six weeks, according to Blackhawks head coach Luke Richardson.
The Washington Capitals placed F Nicklas Backstrom on long-term injured reserve.
Avalanche head coach Jared Bednar said on Thursday (Jan. 2) that Landeskog remains without a timetable to return, as per Corey Masisak of The Denver Post.
